ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Single-Sided Deafness (SSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Profound sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear ('dead ear') with aidable hearing in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of mastoidectomy and facial nerve decompression with progressive conductive component and sensorineural loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Profound Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of sudden hearing loss, stapes surgery, and perilymphatic fistula with no measurable hearing.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech recognition abilities and potential for amplification benefit.
To assess middle ear status given history of surgeries and chronic disease.
To verify hearing aid output against prescriptive and transcranial targets.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results confirm a 'dead' left ear with profound sensorineural loss and a right ear with profound mixed loss. The right ear retains good speech recognition at high levels and has bone conduction thresholds (~30-40 dB HL) sufficient to support transcranial transmission of sound from the left side.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Profound loss (no response > 110 dB HL). Right ear: Mixed loss; profound in lows/highs, moderate in mids (1500-3000 Hz). Right BC avg ~30-40 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 74 dB HL, WRS 88% at 104 dB HL. Left SAT 85 dB HL, WRS 0% at 104 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Flat tympanograms (Type B) bilaterally, consistent with history of middle ear disease and surgery.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Fitting and verification of a Transcranial CROS (Left CIC) and Conventional Right CIC. Real-ear measures confirmed that the left aid met transcranial crossover targets and the right aid met DSL v5.0 targets, ensuring audibility and comfort.

tests.name: Real-ear measures (Probe Microphone)
tests.result_summary: Left ear (Transcranial CROS): Measured REAR for soft input (55 dB SPL) met the transcranial threshold targets (unmasked left thresholds representing crossover). Right ear: Soft, Moderate, and Loud inputs met DSL [i/o] 5.0 targets from 500-4000 Hz.

proposed_items: Fit Transcranial CROS system (Left CIC high power) to route signal via bone conduction to right cochlea
Include push-button volume control on both aids for management of noisy environments
Ensure deep, tight fit for the left instrument to maximize transcranial transmission
counseling_actions: Explain the mechanism of Transcranial CROS (vibrating the skull to send sound to the better ear)
Discuss the benefits of CIC style for bicycle helmet use and telephone placement
Instruct on using the volume control for comfort in noise
Emphasize the need for regular hygiene and ear canal monitoring due to the deep fit and history of infections

escalation.rationale_short: Regular 6-month monitoring of mastoid cavity and ear canal health is required due to history of chronic disease and exposed bone.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Every 6 months (per otologist schedule) or as needed
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor middle/outer ear health and verify continued benefit from amplification.

expected_outcome: The patient was provided with a solution that met his expectations and allowed him to successfully communicate at work and on the telephone.
The patient is able to hear while bicycle riding.
The patient reports using the volume control to provide listening comfort in specific, noisy listening situations.
